intro: Psychotria taurina, commonly known as the "Taurine Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria taurina is also known for its potential psychoactive properties due to the presence of certain alkaloids.
